title: Reading: Lila - An Inquiry into Morals by Robert M. Pirsig -  Chapter 18
description: Lila is not happy, and things just get worse.

transcript_parts.text: hi there
i'm reading chapter 18 of
lila an inquiry into morals by robert m
persic

was
so mad at the captain she could spit
that bastard

a setting up a dog fight she

yes
and you made me one was it me you don't

just dirty you so you'll be just like

she spent

no matter what you do they always want

you're not hurting anybody and you're

and they still just hate you for it
anyway for making love
before you get on you're real angel but

you're real for a while until they

then you're an angel again she'd never
been on the street every night she

just sometimes when she felt like it she

she always did she liked it all the time
every night
so what and she didn't like it always
with the same man
and she didn't care what people thought
about her and she liked money
too to spend and she liked booze too and
a lot of other things
put all that together and you've got
lyla she should have told him
just don't try to turn me into somebody
else because it won't work i'm just lyla
and i'll always be
and if you don't like me the way i am
then just get out
i don't need you i don't need anyone
i'll die first
that's the way i am that's what she
should have told him
a store window showed her reflection she
looked like she was hurrying she
slowed down she didn't have to hurry so

she didn't have anywhere to go except to

it was dumb to tell him anything you
can't tell people like him anything if
you do
they're gone all he wanted her for was
to prove how big he was
he didn't care what she said he just
wanted her to be some kind of guinea pig
to study or something like that
when he really thought all those bad
things about her all the time
he never talked straight but she could
tell he was picking on her in his mind
all the time for the things she said
trying to treat her so nice he always
wanted to know what she thought
but he'd never tell her what he thought
always playing around the edges
that's what she couldn't stand she never
should have told him that stuff about
nerds like him that's what did it
nerds like him couldn't stand to hear
that she knew how to handle people like
him
they're not hard to live with all you
have to do is let them talk
you've got to build someone like him up
all the time or they get rid of you
she'd probably be going on the boat to

shut
she could have taken care of him
whenever he wanted jamie didn't mind
jamie didn't care who she slept with
everybody could have been happy
jamie didn't like the captain either
jamie always knew what people were
thinking
if somebody thought he was going to make
trouble for jamie
jamie had him all figured out a black
witch on a broom
looked at her through a display window
it was almost halloween time
she didn't know this part of the city if
she'd ever been here before she'd
forgotten it
or maybe it had changed so much she
didn't recognize it
everything was always changing here
except the big buildings
when she first came here she used to
think there was somebody up in those
buildings who knows what's going on here
they would never come down and talk to
her after a while she found out nobody
knows what's going on
why wouldn't jaime even give her his

something was wrong she didn't like that
friend of his
maybe it was just the captain being
there she'd never been
on the street before there was something
about it she didn't like
it didn't look dangerous just grungy
jamie always told her look around
and if you don't see any woman walking
by themselves watch out
but there was an old lady with a dog
farther up the street
so if the captain was all done with her
that was nothing new she was used to
that she'd find something
she always landed on her feet a little
shop had some bottles in the windows and
dirt and junk
she always thought they were going to
fix things up someday around here but
nobody ever fixes anything it just gets
worse and worse
an old church had a padlock on the doors
and a sign saying it was closed
the sign was all faded so it must have
been closed for a long time
in a wooden box under the window all the
plants were dead
it didn't look like her grandfather's
church her grandfather's church
was bigger and it wasn't in a dirty city
like this
she'd get a room for a while a few days
maybe and then look around
that sounded good she didn't want to go
back on the street it wasn't worth it
jamie said not to do it and he knows he
said it was too dangerous
it isn't like it used to be she didn't
like this street
she could always get a job waitressing
she knew how to do that
after a while something better would
turn up if she tried to think that way
it would make her feel better but first
she had to find some place to stay
she walked for block after block she

she passed a big hole in the street with
orange and white stands
around it to keep people away there was

a man with a cement sack was staring at

anything just staring she started to
read the writing on all the other signs
leave leave fire lane for emergency
vehicles
snow root no standing during emergency

painting get free estimates 10 percent
off
maybe the signs would tell her what was

they meant no drugs rally irving's

grayer butcher block clothes closet king
audio breakthroughs we sell kosher and

natural health food store 20 off all

she remembered a tree like that in her

but they were never any good for

berries
if she tried to go over there they'd
throw her out some pigeons were there

the patients could be there but she

somebody got inside the iron fence and

she could never figure out what all that

just names or something but they write
it so funny you can't see what they're

they never say you or anything they
just write these strange things
like there's something they know that
nobody knows driver
electric company keep driveway clear one

they never tell you what you want they

some words in hebrew on a wall napoli

franklin cleaners since 1973
police line do not cross blue lines
police department
a lot of barbed wire on the buildings
there didn't used to be all that barbed

him without looking at him personal
touch fine laundry and dry cleaning
hotels hospitals and clubs athens
plumbing and heating
hilarious non-stop laughter i couldn't

laughing mcgillicuddy new york times

one way these shoes hurt the street was

sidewalks were coming apart here they're

so that if she didn't watch out she'd

the glass was from an empty window where
it looked like somebody had tried to
break in
it was beginning to get cold
should be doing something different than
this what was she doing here
something was wrong that she should be
living like this
she should be somewhere better she
crossed a street
and when she looked down at it it looked
like there was water down there
that must be the river she thought she
decided to get a cab
she still had to get to the boat and get
her suitcase off before it got dark
it was too far to walk already her legs
felt worn out
she hadn't walked this far for a long
time a cab would cost a lot
but there wasn't anything else to do if
only she hadn't bought those dumb shirts
but when she came to a corner she saw a
restaurant sign across the street at the
other end of the block
that looked really good she could rest
and get something to eat and call a cab
from there
when she looked through the restaurant
window she saw that the menu was
expensive
the tables inside had clothes on them
and cloth napkins
oh what the hell she thought it was time
to celebrate something
being through with the captain maybe
inside it wasn't crowded a little old
lady waitress was laying out napkins on

she saw lila and gave her a little smile
and came over slowly and showed her
a table by the window at the table lila

it felt really good to sit down the
waitress asked if she would care for
anything to drink before eating
i'll have scotch and soda lila said no
make that a johnny walker black and soda
she smiled
the waitress didn't seem to have much
expression she went off to the bar
the street out the window looked like
some of the streets in rochester
it was old without many people on it in
some
dirt by the gutter under an old fire
escape a cat walked slowly looking for

it pawned the dirt first to one side
than the other
it couldn't seem to find what it was
looking for lila still had her old

over
and they could talk about things she
could call them up and maybe they'd be
able to tell her
where she could find a good room they
might even let her stay with them for a
while you could never tell
she saw through the window that across
the street the cat was gone
the trouble with seeing all her old
friends again was that she didn't want
to
it didn't feel good to think about it
she didn't want to talk to any of them
she wanted to be done with all
that she didn't want to talk to anybody
when the waitress came with a drink lila
gave her a big smile and a big

then went away
lila took a sip of her drink oh did that

good she looked at the menu to see what

she ought to just get something cheap
the trouble was
she was really hungry those steaks
really look good and french fries

she already had too much of that but it

she remembered the french fries she made

she could be making french fries all the

as she thought about this lila saw a

it startled her for a second but then

he wasn't bad looking she smiled at him
he just looked at her then he looked

then he looked at her again she winked

he smiled a little bit then pretended he

she stared down at her own menu but

after a while he moved on she waited to

he was gone she wondered if she'd said
something that made jamie angry
he was so different this time something

something had happened to him and that
was why
he wouldn't give her his address he was
the kind who didn't tell you
he didn't want to hurt your feelings
that's the way he was
the captain wouldn't know anything about
that people like him never do
they just get it off and then think
they've done something big
that's all they know how to do that's
why they have to pay
you try to show them something and you
just waste your time
they don't know what you're doing the
captain never knew what she tried to do
for him
that nerd never would he probably

she had to stop thinking about him the

still hadn't made up her mind i guess
i'm not ready yet
she said she looked inside her glass why
don't you bring me another one of these
she didn't want to get boozy she still
had a lot of things to do but
this felt really good it would be a long

she didn't know what she would do next
it seemed like she'd done it all
she didn't have as much strength anymore
or something she was tired

she wondered where that cat went to that

she didn't like the dark in rochester it

maybe she could just go back to
rochester and get a regular job
she couldn't go back they all hated her

that's why they fired her because she

everybody wants to turn you into a

then you're no good then you're bad no

you're still no good you can never serve

they've always got to have more so it

she'd still be there on her way to

she didn't care she didn't want to go

what was it she wanted to do it was

it wasn't anything she wanted to do that

she didn't want to have anything more to

tired of people she just wanted to go

all alone the waitress came again
lila ordered another drink that wasn't

her stomach still hurt she should have

earlier she reached into her purse to

she couldn't find them that was funny
she knew they were right there
the other pills weren't there either she

to find the round plastic bottle she

it wasn't there she poked harder and

she didn't leave them in the boat
because she took three this morning
she brought the purse up and looked

then she looked in the other pocket of

then lila suddenly knew that the
billfold wasn't inside the purse either
she looked up and felt frightened
outside the window
the street had become darker she reached

all her pockets everywhere in her purse
but it was gone
it was really gone that was all the

some other customers were coming in they

lila didn't see the little old lady

he had a bow tie she didn't like his

she still couldn't believe it how could

all her money was in there it couldn't

she bought the shirts with it she

she knew there was something wrong about

wait till she told jamie lyla looked

it was empty she didn't have jamie's new

she couldn't even order dinner she had

she couldn't even think straight is that
why jamie didn't give her his number
so there was no way she could tell him
so he could set her up
the waiter came over i'm not ready yet
lyla told him
he gave her a nothing look and went away
jamie wouldn't have done that when jamie

he didn't have to steal from her it was

she wished she hadn't had those drinks
there was a coin purse inside he didn't

she took it out and counted it two

she didn't even have enough to pay for

she felt sick she had to go to the

the toilet stank she tried to wash but

this was a goddamn dump this place her

but there was nowhere to wash this dirty

she saw in the mirror her hair was dirty

if she used the coins to call some

they could come and help but it was four

nobody stayed still for four years in

when she got to the phone on the first

the phone rang and rang while it was
ringing she realized
that if she wanted she could go out the

and they wouldn't be able to stop her
the waiter was watching her
he'd stop her he looked mean
he looked like he'd been around lori's
phone didn't answer that was all right
that meant she got the coin back but
then it answered
and the voice asked who was calling she
said lila blew it
the women went away and lila waited
thank god lori was still there
but then the voice came back and said
you must have the wrong number
and hung up what did that mean
she tried two other numbers and got her

she wouldn't help even if she remembered
her the waiter was still watching
lila thought about him for a while what

she might as well get it over with she
braced herself
and went over and told him somebody
stole my money i can't pay
he just looked at her he didn't say
anything
she wondered if he'd heard what she said
then he said what were you putting in

that was coins lila said they took my
billfold
he just stared at her some more she
could see he didn't believe her
after a while he said they took your
billfold
yes she said he stared at her some more
then he said
i just work here the manager isn't here
he turned and went out to the kitchen
when he came back he said
they said to leave your name and address
i don't have an address she said
he stared at her some more you don't
have an address he repeated
that's what i said she was starting to
get mad
where do you live on a boat where's the
boat he asked
she wondered why he wanted to know that
what was he going to do now
on the river she said it doesn't matter
i have to leave tonight
i don't know where the boat is the
waiter kept staring at her jesus christ
what a starer
well just sign the name of the boat he
said
he looked at where she signed the piece
of paper and then he gave her a dirty
look and said
and now when you get back to your boat
please get some money from your boat
and bring it back here okay because
other people got to live too you know
she picked up her purse and shirts from

and saw him smile at somebody back in

and shake his head and she went out the
door at least he wasn't as bad as she
thought he was going to be
he could have called the cops or
something he probably thought she was
some kind of crazy person
it was getting cold and the street looks

the restaurant door closed behind her
she could have left this box of shirts
to pay for it she thought
now she had to carry them but he never

she thought about going back and giving
them to him no it was all over
he wouldn't take them anyway but there
is no reason for him to look dirty at
her like that
lila thought she buttoned her cardigan
they didn't pay him to look like that
maybe the captain would like them when
he saw them
then he would give her some money to pay
the restaurant and they could go back
and have a meal
and he wouldn't give the waiter any tip
no they'd give him a
super big tip just to make him feel bad
she didn't have any money to take a cab
now she couldn't call the police
maybe she could call the police they
probably wouldn't remember her
nobody remembered her but she didn't
want to do that
everybody was gone where was everybody
gone she wondered
what's happening that everybody's gone
first the captain is gone
and then jamie is gone and richard too
even richard is gone
she never did anything to him something
really bad was happening
but they weren't telling her what it was
they didn't want her to know
lila began to feel her hands shake a

and then remembered they were gone too
she began to feel scared
this was the first time since the
hospital that she didn't have them
she didn't know how far it was to the
boat it was toward the river
in this direction she thought maybe not
she'd try not to think about anything
bad
and maybe her hands would stop shaking
she hoped this was the right direction
it was so dark now
